meta.dc:title: 117 H. CON. RES. 27 ENR: Permitting the remains of the late United States Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol.
meta.dc:creator: U.S. House of Representatives
meta.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
meta.processedBy: Xcential BillDTD to USLM Converter v20210601

preface.congress: One Hundred Seventeenth Congress of the United States of America
preface.enrolledDateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Sunday, the third day of January, two thousand and twenty-one

longTitle.officialTitle: Permitting the remains of the late United States Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol.

main.enactingFormula: Resolved by the House of Representatives (the Senate concurring),

section.content: That the remains of the late United States Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans shall be permitted to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol on April 13, 2021, and the Architect of the Capitol, under the direction of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate, shall take all necessary steps for the accomplishment of that purpose.

signature.role: Clerk of the House of Representatives.
